Description: Fragment of an ostracon from a pottery vessel, showing remains of two(?) lines of hieratic in black ink written on the outside of the sherd. There are several black accretions at the outside which make it difficult to define the amount of lines of text. The sherd is part of a plate with a diameter of about 25cm, very well finished at the inside, quite rough at the outside. Nile clay with chaff and mica inclusions, wheel turned, traces of clay scraped off at the outside. In the base of the vessel remains of black stains, possible used as a lamp.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 65)
